meanings.definition: In a harmful or unfavorable manner.
meanings.sent1: She reacted negatively to the news of the storm.
meanings.sent2: The medicine did not work negatively on her condition.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly claimed that eating vegetables would negatively impact his love for pizza.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds loomed overhead, casting a negatively gloomy shadow on the town.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise negatively affected her ability to concentrate.

meanings.sent1: Her negatively worded response left no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent2: The sign had a negatively clear message for trespassers.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a negatively stern look when offered a bath.
meanings.sent4: His face had a negatively firm expression when asked to share his dessert.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's negatively tone indicated she was not open to further discussion.

meanings.sent1: The committee gave a negatively review of the proposal.
meanings.sent2: Her negatively raised eyebrows spoke volumes about her opinion.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a negatively bark at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: The painting received a negatively harsh critique from the art critic.
